test.name: Ancestry's Advanced Paternal Lineage test (Y-Chromosome 33)
test.description: Paternal Lineage Test (Y-Chromosome 33) helps you connect with living relatives and possibly add them to your family tree.

test.name: Ancestry's Advanced Paternal Lineage test (Y-Chromosome 46)
test.description: The Advanced Paternal Test (Y-Chromosome 46) helps you connect with living relatives and possibly add them to your family tree.

test.name: Maternal Lineage DNA Test (mtDNA)
test.description: Maternal Lineage tests are derived from mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) which is passed from a mother to her male and female children. Thus mtDNA is a powerful investigative tool for researching the maternal line and identifying one's maternal ancient ancestry.

test.name: Ancestry by DNA DNAPrint STR Map
test.description: The paternal lineage test is based on the fact that the Y chromosome is passed down from father to child relatively unchanged.

test.name: Maternal Lineage (mtDNA) Testing
test.description: The maternal lineage test is based on the fact that mitochondrial DNA is passed down from mother to child relatively unchanged through several generations. This mitochondrial DNA test contains markers that can be traced to early ancestors and where they settled thousands of years ago.

test.name: Fingerprint Test
test.description: The DNA Fingerprint autosomal Test computes the likelihood of its matches on the basis of contemporary populations, to tell you which countries and ethnic groups your ancestors came from. Your DNA Fingerprint can also help explain the origin of physical traits that you or your relatives may possess.

test.name: DNA Heritage Y-DNA 23 Marker Test
test.description: Y-chromosome SNP tests in a hierarchical manner testing from the very root of the Y-Chromosome Tree. The test will define which Y-chromosome haplogroup you are in.

test.name: DNA Heritage Y-DNA 43 Marker Test
test.description: Y-chromosome SNP tests in a hierarchical manner testing from the very root of the Y-Chromosome Tree. The test will define which Y-chromosome haplogroup you are in.

test.name: DNA Heritage Y-DNA 58 Marker Test
test.description: Y-chromosome SNP tests in a hierarchical manner testing from the very root of the Y-Chromosome Tree. The test will define which Y-chromosome haplogroup you are in.

test.name: Maternal Roots Test
test.description: HVR 1, 2 and 3 regions are all sequenced, compared against the revised Cambridge Reference Sequence (CRS). From this the test predicts your mtDNA haplogroup and provides a report containing up-to-date, PhD researched information and maps.

test.name: DNA Tribes 15-Marker Standard Kit test
test.description: DNA test for 15-Marker gives you the option to compare your DNA to populations and regions around the world.

test.name: DNA Tribes 21-Marker Standard Kit test
test.description: DNA test for 21-Marker gives you the option to compare your DNA to populations and regions around the world.

test.name: DNA Tribes 27-Marker Standard Kit test
test.description: DNA test for 27-Marker gives you the option to compare your DNA to populations and regions around the world.

test.name: Paternal BRONZE (YDNA-12)
test.description: Find out about your deep ancestry roots. The result provides your deep roots (Y-Haplogroup) and 12 marker Y-DNA profile.

test.name: Paternal SILVER (YDNA-25)
test.description: It will show if you share a common relative with annother male in near time. The result provides your deep roots (Y-Haplogroup) and 25 marker Y-DNA profile.

test.name: Paternal GOLD (YDNA-37)
test.description: The result provides your deep roots (Y-Haplogroup) and 37 marker Y-DNA profile.

test.name: Paternal PLATINUM (YDNA-67)
test.description: The Advanced Test allows you to see nearly exactly if two males shared a common ancestor in recent times with a very high degree of certainty.

test.name: Maternal - BRONZE - Deep Roots (mtDNA)
test.description: Detailed testing on your direct female line to establish your ancestry group (haplogroup).

test.name: Maternal - GOLD - Deep Roots + Relatives (mtDNAFull)
test.description: Your deep ancestry plus your full mtDNA sequenced. This provides the most detailed information to establish if two people are closely related.

test.name: Haploview Complete Y-Chromosome DNA Test
test.description: These 20 markers generate a high resolution Y chromosome haplotype which allows identification of related matches sharing recent common ancestry. The standard 12 markers are included here supplemented with other markers which aid identification of haplogroups and interesting subgroups for deep ancestral origins.

test.name: Haploview-mtDNA
test.description: This test traces your maternal lineage using a segment of DNA known as mitochondrial DNA or mtDNA which is passed down from mother to child. Ethnoancestry tests a very variable section of the mtDNA (hypervariable region 1), which allows different lineages to be distinguished.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA Y-DNA 12 Marker Test
test.description: This test is the world standard to verify the Y chromosome for genetic matches between males.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA Y-DNAPlus 25 Marker Test
test.description: A perfect match of 25 markers means a lesser number of generations before 2 individuals shared a commong ancestor.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA Y-DNA 37 Marker Test
test.description: A high resolution Y-DNA test. A perfect match means sharing a commong ancestor in the last few generations.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA Y-DNA 67 Marker Test
test.description: A high resolution Y-DNA test. A perfect match means sharing a commong ancestor in the last few generations.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA Y-DNA 111 Marker Test
test.description: A high resolution Y-DNA test. A perfect match means sharing a commong ancestor in the last few generations.

test.name: X-STR DNA tests for siblingship (Panel 1)
test.description: This is a set of six X-chromosome short tandem repeat, STR.

test.name: X-STR DNA tests for siblingship (Panel 1 and Panel 2)
test.description: This is a set of seventeen X-chromosome short tandem repeat, STR.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA mtDNA Basic
test.description: This test traces the direct maternal line without influence from other lines. This test is for HVR1(16001-16569) of the mitochondrial DNA and both men and women may take it.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA mtDNA Plus
test.description: This test traces the direct maternal line without influence from other lines. This test is for HVR1(16001-16569) and HVR2(00001-00574) of the mitochondrial DNA. Adding HVR2 reduces the number of false matches. Both men and women may take it.

test.name: FamilyTree DNA mtDNA Full Sequence
test.description: This test exclusively traces the direct maternal line without influence from other lines. This test is for all three regions of the mitochondrial DNA: HVR1 (16001-16569), HVR2 (00001-00574), and the coding region (00575-16000). The entire mitochondrial genome is tested. Both men and women may take it.

test.name: Enhanced Paternal Lineage Test (Y-DNA 46 marker)
test.description: The Y chromosome follows the paternal line. In western cultures, this is the same path as the surname. Any man with a matching genetic profile is considered your paternal relative. Find genetic cousins and learn about ancient paternal ancestry.

test.name: Enhanced Maternal Lineage Test (mtDNA HVR-1,2,3)
test.description: The mtDNA testing is an ideal way to find out more information about your direct maternal lineage. Any individual with a matching genetic profile can be considered your maternal relative. Discover the early human migrations of your maternal line and connect with those sharing your maternal ancestry.

test.name: Ancestral Origins - Ancestry by DNA test
test.description: This test can tell you where on earth your ancestors originated and travelled, your unique geographical and racial heritage. Discover your GeoGenetic links with populations around the world.

test.name: Oxford Ancestors Y Clan analysis 15-marker test
test.description: DNA analysis-based determination of 15-digit Y-Clan signature allowing assessment of ancient paternal clan. In addition the 15-digit signature can be used as an aid to genealogical research.

test.name: MatriLine DNA Service
test.description: The MatriLine service gives you the opportunity to establish the personal link between you and your ancestral clan mother. There are currently 36 identified clan mothers who cover the whole of humanity. The test establishes to which clan mother you are related, incuding information about how and when she lived.

test.name: Family Tree Pruner - 18 Marker Test
test.description: The Family Tree Pruner's primary purpose is to determine if branches can be eliminated from your family tree. If you have a common surname or are simply trying to find out if you are related to a specific group.

test.name: Family Line Verifier - 26 Marker Test
test.description: The Family Line Verifier will verify relationships along your paternal family line.

test.name: Lineage Establisher - 43 Marker Test
test.description: The Lineage Establisher can help to establish lineages and answer specific questions within your family group.
